Posts.Content: I have a 1 year old and was told that unless they are ill, being sick etc everything is fine. Just getting people to get into the routine of washing hands they will understand. I had hand gel in every room.  All the best on your journey xx
Posts.Title: risk of infection- chemo

Posts.Content: Oh no I hope you recover quickly, I also burned on my face with factor 30 on, since changed to factor 50 and hats , so difficult in this heat !!  Take care xx
Posts.Title: sunburn

Posts.Content: Well today is my last treatment after  8 months of chemo  FEC/T and a mastectomy and radiotherapy. One minute i,m happy the next i am a blubbering mess.Want to scream the loudest yesss i did it !! then want to crawl under my covers.  Will and determination and a great family and friend support got me through and of course Macmillan. Now what.... well i intend to live life to the fullest, i know i have a ways to go on the recovery and the lovely  tamoxifen , which only side effect i have is the sweats.  I put a little blog on here about my experiences, if anyone would like to leave hints or tips for those still fighting the fight and winning or any questions about fec/t or mastectomy etc .  Lots of love and strength to you all Donna xxx
Posts.Title: Emotional rollercoaster

Posts.Content: Yes it did that's why I went to the doctor, who examined me and sent me for mammogram and scan. Have you had surgery before the chemo ? I had surgery after xx the chemo gave me sore boobs but that's the chemo working.
Posts.Title: Emotional rollercoaster

Posts.Content: Hi, For me it was every day was different, do what your body is telling you, if you need to rest ..rest, if you feel you want to go for a walk...walk, if you want to cry or scream or yell its ok. You will feel all those but you will get through it. I remember on my 5th session on FEC/T i was inconsolable, yelling and allsorts, i went into my oncologist and said why is this happening so bad now after 5 treatments, she said it was normal everyone seems to breakdown at the same point. the next day i was totally fine, letting it all out is a release, talking about it is a stress reliever aswell.  I did find if i new what was coming i could prepare myself for example i new i was getting a bad cold i could feel it i went to my dr and he gave me anti biotics and a blood test and sure enough i had an infection, i caught it before it progressed. I also took sickness tablets before each session not after. Have a look at the blog i wrote on here about hints and tips , cerain things can help ease. It is tough going i wont lie but you will get through it, then afterwards like me its like when you had a baby and after he or she is born you say to your self omg did i really just go through that i know what i went through i just cant remember feeling it !!  Be strong you will do just fine, listen to the doctors and most of all your own body  Is it FEC/T you are starting ? Donna xx
Posts.Title: Emotional rollercoaster

Posts.Content: Get back onto the phone to your nurse , they have check it. 4 days is a long time in the scheme of things. Callfirst thing in the morning, you dont need the added stress. Donna xx
Posts.Title: Emotional rollercoaster

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with invasive lobular stage 2, apparently its quite rare, theres so many different types, i had no idea, all the best for thursday x
Posts.Title: Emotional rollercoaster

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with invasive lobular stage 2, apparently its quite rare, theres so many different types, i had no idea, all the best for thursday x

Posts.Title: Emotional rollercoaster

Posts.Content: Thank you Helen, i,m alot better today i know each day is going to be different, just keep on going. I will take a look, thank you  Donna xx
Posts.Title: Emotional rollercoaster

Posts.Content: Big hugs Emma, it is scary and you are young, you have a lot to fight for. I am 42 and my Dr said to me I had age on my side as well as treatment, yet I was too young for other treatments, there's always two sides. I keep everything crossed for you on your wanting to be a mum. Stay strong you will get through it stay determined, it will be hard some days, do as your body tells you that is the best advice, if your worried about anything you pick up the phone to your Mac nurse or Dr that's what they are there for. When I started I never wanted to call I didn't want to bother them as they are busy but I learned quickly too call if I needed too.  All the best for Thursday ...onwards and upwards go kick its ass !!! Love n hugs Donna xx
